summarizes the written evidence for the foundation of Taranto. Fischer-Bossert (1999, 410–423) challenges the conventional view that the name of the river Taras precedes that of the hero, who is a later development and initially has no connection with the dolphin, whereas Phalanthos has this association from at least the fifth century BC onward

note: Cf. Garraffo (1995, 148–149); Nafissi (1995, 292–299). Dolphin riders occasionally appear on other coinage as well, such as that from early fifth century BC Skopelos (Peparethus).
title: Fischer-Bossert
